# Targeted Therapy and Personalised Treatment Approaches

Targeted therapy is a cancer treatment that uses drugs designed to 'target' specific molecules (suchane as proteins) on or inside cancer cells. These molecules are typically involved in cell growth, division, and spread. Personalised treatment approaches tailor medical decisions, practices, and/or products to the individual patient based on their predicted response or risk of disease. In the context of cancer, this often involves using genomic or molecular information from a patient's tumor to select the most effective targeted therapy, moving away from a 'one-size-fits-all' model.## Index
